cab.content: From Viceroy. Army Department, to Secretary of Slate for Twdia,2-HhJune 1919.(Received 2(ith, 10.30 a.m.) No. 8566. 24th June. Malleson wires 22nd June:-"Some newly arrived detachments of Oossacks attacked Bolsheviks at Dnshakh on 20th-21st. June. Scored a complete success. Bolsheviks lost 100 prisoners, and 300 dead were left on the ground. They also lost two armoured trains (the guns in which were deprived of breech blocks) and 29 machine guns. Numbers of cattle, horses, and camels were also captured. This success will encourage Turkomans and greatly hearten Trans-Caspians."
